title: Ping muting, surrender at 15, and more on the way

replies.body: But still even though it will be surrender at 15 now. You will have that yasuo and vayne thats like, " ITS OK BOIS I SCALE RULLY GOOD." Then they proceed to feed 4 kills within the next 5 minutes.
toxic banned
LOL possibly the funniest comment with no words I've seen in a while
The biggest issue won't be that...its hard enough to get 4 people to agree to surrender at 20 minutes...you won't have a team that 5 agree to it like.....ever lol
I really want a "there's a ward there" ping
We need a "Place ward here" and a "There's a ward/trap here"
The basic blue ping already denotes "place a ward here".

I disagree, pings in general, and specifically the basic blue pings, are forced into an awkward position that is entirely relevant to the context that they are issued in.  A blue ping can mean "place ward," "push the lane," or "I saw someone."  While a mia ping can mean "no enemy in my lane," "Not sure if someone is in this bush," or "Enemy may be at this objective," etc.

Unfortunately, we don't have definitive pings so all pings are purely context-sensitive and the less you know about context, the less useful pings are.

I main support and also ping the bush and my trinket cooldown. It usually works but one time the adc said he didn't have a ward.... No sir, I can see your trinket has a charge.
*adc continues pushing without ward* 
obviously he died to a gank. I guess I tried.

I've had somebody relay to me through pings that they wanted me to put a ward in a bush by pinging the bush and pinging that their trinket was on cooldown and  also pinging an assist request.

of course they were bot and I was support.. it was kind of annoying at first not knowing what they wanted but it did work when I figured it out.

So yes, I am behind the ward info pings, but until that is implemented keep in mind you can combo pings to try to get your message across.

ward, trap, shroom, sapling etc
EDIT WE JUST NEED MORE PINGS.
ALL THE PINGS
They should make it that pinging over a ward will give a special WARD ping (same with shroom, trap)

This would easily be abused though. See support walk up river into fog of war? Spam ping around common ward locations to find ward. Even with a disable on spamming ping, there are a few locations and an educated guess would more than likely give it away.
He meant in the same vein as pinging an enemy champion. You can't ping an enemy unless they're within vision, and you wouldn't be able to ping a ward if it wasn't either.

Oh Gods yes!
Preach Brother!
You can already tell that the omw ping is going to get annoying very quickly.
We're hoping it's more helpful than obnoxious, but now we've got ping muting for potentially young/toxic players.

Maybe I missed this or it is implied, but will the whole team be able to hear these new on my way pings?  Or asked another way, is the point of the ping sounds building in a melody another way to help everyone hear as well as see where people are going?
The whole team will hear them. So if three players OMW ping dragon, you'll hear those first three tones from the video.

Say I ping mute one teammate. Does their "OMW" ping still contribute to the team agreement melody increase? I just won't actually see their contribution, but I might still hear a 5th-level-agreement ping at some point? 

( I ask because I would actually prefer this-- it limits their pinging only to helpful situations rather than BM spam. )

So as far as I can understand, it means if we mute pings, we are muting the whole team's ping (every type of pings) rather than a single person? It mentions just an option to mute pings, and gives it as an example as muting chat which mutes all chat. If that is true, and its meant to block all pings, why is Riot doing this type of "marketing tactic"? Rather than fix the issue right away (for this case, allow us to block a specific person from pinging us), you start from the bottom and just make it block everyone first then later on in patches you work on towards that lol. (P.S., if this option allows us to mute pings from a specific person , then excuse everything I said above :D and have a "thank you very much" response in replace)
It's most certainly "block a specific person from pinging", just like regular mute.
Ignore my message. I read the comment and section and some other Riot-er stated specific person. SORRY much love and thank you
Oh ok awesome!  Thanks for the quick response!

> young/toxic players

Gottem :D
If you have a player's pings muted and they ping omw between unmuted players will you hear the melody stacked with or without them included.
I think it's the tinny, metallic sound that caught me off guard, and that I suspect will get annoying quickly. Who knows? I may be wrong.

Yeah its really harsh sounding.  The old ping was very pleasing and light while still being distinct.

Im a lil surprised how harsh a lot of the sound effects have been getting.

What's the radius on this "common ping" location? The video shows them nearly overlapping each other. (i.e.: A ping on top of the drake's Speed Shrine _should_ build with a ping in the center of the drake pit, as they would surely indicate the same intention).
That's exactly the sort of thing we're still figuring out and testing internally. Just wanted to get y'all an early look and collect thoughts :)

Here's a thought:

I don't really know how your code works (and as a seasoned programmer, I don't think I want to) but wouldn't it be possible to make the ping an interactable (like thresh lantern or honeyfruit) that spawns an object (only visible to your team) that says "X is going here, click to join" or something to that effect? You click a green button in the middle of the ping and that spawns a going here ping nearest to that ping.

Or you could just add a new texture layer to the original "on my way" ping that shows the outline of a range indicator (let's say somewhere between 5-10 teemos) and then have a line of code (which I guess already exists according to the video above) that checks for whether or not the team pings is in "harmony" with the original ping. You could even make it so that repeated "on my way" pings from the first shotcaller or overeager teammates do not contribute to the melody by adding exceptions. I guess the odd part in that case will be checking for edge case scenarios (such as opposite sides of walls) which could be misconstrued. Smaller range might be the way to go to avoid that and then relying on common sense of players to figure out the rest.

Another thing worth considering is how do you prevent a shotcalled from pinging multiple locations and teammates pinging those locations afterwards? The ping limit only does so much. I'd recommend a cooldown for on my way pings.
Watch them make it within one Teemo of the original ping, lol.
I love the ping melody, that's so genius and no one even asked for it...
please don't make the "on my way" pings so high pitched. It's annoying and hurts my head if I have a headache.
Why are you playing with a headache in the first place?
The new sound design of League is what gave him the headache.

What happened to Item Set Builder that was slated for 7.10? You guys have been silent on its progression, and it's clearly not coming out in 7.10 as you guys said it would.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/legacy-client-now-retired?ref=rss&utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=twitter

Never saw it hit pbe once.

Bruh...

http://www.surrenderat20.net/p/710-pbe-cycle.html#itemsets
I stand corrected and am a moron. I vaguely remember seeing this a few days ago. No mentions of it in patch notes so I guess it's not going out with 7.10.

Still on PBE for further testing: http://www.surrenderat20.net/2017/05/516-pbe-update.html#misc

I think it's reasonable to assume the feature will hit live in 7.11 given the amount of polish it has on PBE already, but that's still an assumption at the end of the day.

I think complete ping is a bit overkill. It'd make more sense if it just muted the audio, or repeated pings. I think it'd be best to make it so when someone pings danger (for example), then it will mute any other danger pings from that person for X (5? 10?) seconds.
I get that people spamming pings is annoying, but it'd be nice to stop the spam without stopping them from sending you information.

Blaming the Jungler for throwing at Baron
Classic

"We're going to fix player frustration but giving them a chance to come back from snowbally games"

YAY!!!!

"So we give you FF at 15"

? ? ? ??????? ? ???????????????????????? ? "you must wait before sending pings"
The new ping sounds like fucking minecraft anvil.
Might be a dumb question, but for the surrender at 15 what does non-RGM games mean?
rotating game mode.  Basically the weekend game mode
